QUESTION
I am a Punjabi Sikh based in India of age 19 years. I wanted to ask you the deeper meaning behind a dream of mine which I had around 3:30 a.m. in the morning. The dream was that I visualized a rectangular structure which was like a tent black in colour and had frills resembling the Mecca, it was bright sunlight all around and I saw the sky up above which was totally bright with a bright streak of light coming into my eyes. The next thing I saw was that I was in a telling my parents that I want to convert to islam , it was a big hall and I had a thick book in my hand. Thank You. ANUJ MADAN P.S.: As I do not frequent your website being a non-muslim could you please reply on my personal e-mail madan@uwindsor.ca
ANSWER

Hope you are well. The dream is indeed a blessed and true dream.

The rectangular structure seen by you was the Ka'bah, the holy house in
Makkah built by the Prophet Ebrahim (Abraham). That is the direction of
prayers for a Muslim. The dream is an indication for you to change your
direction of life to the truth - Allah and Islam.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best
